briefdescription.para: Function to determine the initial rotational state for which the free mode is fully damped.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to determine the initial rotational state for which the free mode is fully damped, using the approach of Rambaux et al. (2012). Using this method, the dynamics is propagated forward in time with an artificial damping, and backwards in time without this damping. The process is repeated for an ever increasing value of the dissipation time. Using this function, the numerical state and dependent variables at each of the iterations is returned (by reference) by the function. Additionally, the results can be written to files after each iteration.
bodies
Map of bodies in the propagation, with keys the names of the bodies.
integratorSettings
Settings for the numerical integration scheme
propagatorSettings
Settings for the propagator, must include rotational dynamics of only a single body, but may also include translational dynamics.
bodyMeanRotationRate
Mean rotation rate of body for which the initial state is to be determined, used in the computation of the dissipation matrix.
dissipationTimes
List of characteristic times for dissipation matrix (in order of which they will be used)
propagatedStates
Numerical states for each iteration
dependentVariables
Dependent variables for each iteration
propagateNominal
Boolean designating whether the undamped dynamics is also to be propagated (saved in index 0)
writeToFileInLoop
Boolean designating whether the results are written to files after each iteration. NOTE: setting this variable to true will result in propagatedStates and dependentVariables being returned empty (the data being stored in files instead)
baseFileName
File name prefix used for files, if writeToFileInLoop is true
outputFolder
Directory to which files will be written, if writeToFileInLoop is true

briefdescription.para: Function that propagates to an exact final condition (within tolerance) for dependent variable termination condition.

detaileddescription.para:
Function that propagates to an exact final condition (within tolerance) for dependent variable termination condition. Determines the time step that is to be taken by using a root finder, and returns (by reference) the converged final time and state.
integrator
Numerical integrator that is used for propagation. Upon input to this function, the integrator is rolled back to the secondToLastTime/secondToLastState
dependentVariableTerminationCondition
Termination condition that is to be used
secondToLastTime
Second to last time (e.g. last time at which integration did not exceed termination condition)
lastTime
Time at which integration first exceeded termination condition
secondToLastState
Second to last state (e.g. state at last time where integration did not exceed termination condition)
lastState
State at time where integration first exceeded termination condition
endTime
Time at which exact termination condition is met (returned by reference).
endState
State at time where exact termination condition is met (returned by reference).

memberdef.name: removeCentralGravityAccelerations

briefdescription.para: Function to remove the central gravity acceleration from an AccelerationMap.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to remove the central gravity acceleration from an AccelerationMap. This is crucial for propagation methods in which the deviation from a reference Kepler orbit is propagated. If the central gravity is a spherical harmonic acceleration, the point mass term is removed by setting the C(0,0) coefficnet to 0
bodiesToIntegrate
List of names of bodies that are to be integrated numerically.
centralBodies
List of names of bodies of which the central terms are to be removed (per entry of bodiesToIntegrate)
accelerationModelsPerBody
A map containing the list of accelerations acting on each body, identifying the body being acted on and the body acted on by an acceleration. The map has as key a string denoting the name of the body the list of accelerations, provided as the value corresponding to a key, is acting on. This map-value is again a map with string as key, denoting the body exerting the acceleration, and as value a pointer to an acceleration model.
Functions returning the gravitational parameters of the central terms that were removed.

memberdef.name: computeStateDerivativeForUnifiedStateModelExponentialMap

briefdescription.para: Function to evaluate the equations of motion for the unifies state model with exponential map (USMEM)

detaileddescription.para: Function to evaluate the state derivative for the unified state model with exponential map.

Function to evaluate the equations of motion for the unifies state model with exponential map (USMEM), providing the time-derivatives of USMEM elements from the accelerations expressed in an RSW frame (see Vallado, 2001). This function takes a number of precomputed quantities as input, to reduce computational burden
currentUnifiedStateModelElements
Current USMEM elements of the body for which the equations of motion are to be evaluated
accelerationsInRswFrame
Accelerations acting on body, expressed in RSW frame
sineLambdaParameter
Sine of the right ascension of latitude
cosineLambdaParameter
Cosine of the right ascension of latitude
gammaParameter
Value of the parameter gamma (see Vittaldev, 2010)
rotationalVelocityVector
Rotational velocity of the local orbital frame w.r.t. the inertial frame (see Vittaldev, 2010)
pParameterVector
Value of the vector gamma (see Vittaldev, 2010)
Time derivatives of USMEM elements.

accelerationsInInertialFrame

centralBodyGravitationalParameter
Gravitational parameter of sum of central body and body for which orbit is propagated.
Time derivatives of USMEM elements.

memberdef.name: setVariationalEquationsSolution

param.type: std::map< TimeType, Eigen::Matrix< StateScalarType, Eigen::Dynamic, Eigen::Dynamic > > &

briefdescription.para: Function to separate the time histories of the sensitivity and state transition matrices from a full numerical solution.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to separate the time histories of the sensitivity and state transition matrices from a full numerical solution, in which the solution is represented as a single matrix block per time value. NOTE: numericalIntegrationResult contents are deleted by this function (all information is conserved in variationalEquationsSolution.
numericalIntegrationResult
Full time history from which separate matrix histories are to be retrieved.
variationalEquationsSolution
Vector of two matrix histories (returned by reference). First vector entry is state transition matrix history, second entry is sensitivity matrix history.
stateTransitionStartIndices

briefdescription.para: Setup CR3BP system of bodies.

detaileddescription.para: Function to directly setup CR3BP bodies.

Setup CR3BP system of bodies. The two primaries, as well as the third, smaller body to be propagated are defined in the system of bodies. The two primaries are in circular orbit about their barycenter, orbiting it with the same mean motion, so that they stay aligned during propagation.

Distance between primaries [m].

Name of the primary body.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to propagate the full dynamics problem and the Lambert targeter solution. The propagator settings for the full problem propagation are directly provided as inputs.
timeOfFlight
Time of flight [s].
initialTime
Initial time of the propagation [s].
bodies
Body map.
centralBody
Name of the central body for the Lambert targeter.
propagatorSettings
Propagator settings for the full problem.
integratorSettings
Integrator settings for the propagation.
lambertTargeterResult
Map of the cartesian state obtained with the Lambert targeter as a function of time (modified within the function).
fullProblemResult
Map of the cartesian state obtained after propagation of the full dynamics problem as a function of time (modified within the function).
cartesianPositionAtDeparture
Cartesian position of the body to be propagated at departure [m].
cartesianPositionAtArrival
Cartesian position of the body to be propagated at arrival [m].
centralBodyGravitationalParameter
Gravitational parameter of the central body [m^3 s^-2]. If not provided as input, it is retrieved from the system of bodies.

memberdef.name: propagateLambertTargeterAndFullProblem

briefdescription.para: Function to propagate the full dynamics problem and the Lambert targeter solution.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to propagate the full dynamics problem and the Lambert targeter solution. The function computes the cartesian state as a function of time in two different ways: from the Lambert targeter and from the propagation of the full dynamics problem. The propagator settings are defined inside the function from the propagator type and dependent variables to save provided as inputs.
timeOfFlight
Time of flight [s].
initialTime
Initial time of the propagation [s].
bodies
Body map.
accelerationModelMap
Acceleration map.
bodyToPropagate
Name of the body to be propagated.
centralBody
Name of the central body for the Lambert targeter.
integratorSettings
Integrator settings for the propagation.
lambertTargeterResult
Map of the cartesian state obtained with the Lambert targeter as a function of time (modified within the function).
fullProblemResult
Map of the cartesian state obtained after propagation of the full dynamics problem as a function of time (modified within the function).
terminationSphereOfInfluence
Boolean denoting whether the propagation stops at the position of the departure and arrival body (false) or at the sphere of influence of the departure and arrival body (true).
cartesianPositionAtDeparture
Cartesian position of the body to be propagated at departure [m].
cartesianPositionAtArrival
Cartesian position of the body to be propagated at arrival [m].
departureBodyGravitationalParameter
Gravitational parameter of the departure body [m^3 s^-2]. If not provided as input, it is retrieved from the system of bodies.
arrivalBodyGravitationalParameter
Gravitational parameter of the arrival body [m^3 s^-2]. If not provided as input, it is retrieved from the system of bodies.
centralBodyGravitationalParameter
Gravitational parameter of the central body [m^3 s^-2]. If not provided as input, it is retrieved from the system of bodies.
dependentVariablesToSave
List of dependent variables to be saved during the full problem propagation.
propagator
Type of propagator to be used for the propagation of the full dynamics problem.

Initial time of the propagation [s].
bodies
Body map.
accelerationModelMap
Acceleration map.
bodyToPropagate
Names of the body to be propagated.
centralBody
Names of the central body of propagation
integratorSettings
Integrator settings for the propagation.
terminationSphereOfInfluence
Boolean denoting whether the propagation stops at the position of the departure and arrival body (false) or at the sphere of influence of the departure and arrival body (true).

detaileddescription.para: Function to setup a system of bodies corresponding to the assumptions of a patched conics trajectory, using default ephemerides for the central and transfer bodies.

Function to setup a system of bodies for the patched conics trajectory. The system of bodies contains the central body, the transfer bodies and the body to be propagated. The positions of the central and transfer bodies are directly retrieved from ephemerides.
nameCentralBody
Name of the central body.
nameBodyToPropagate
Name of the body to be propagated.
nameTransferBodies
Vector containing the names of the transfer bodies.
Body map for the patched conics trajectory.
Function to setup a system of bodies corresponding to the assumptions of a patched conics trajectory, using default ephemerides for the central and transfer bodies.

detaileddescription.para: Function to setup a system of bodies corresponding to the assumptions of the patched conics trajectory, the ephemerides of the transfer bodies being provided as inputs.

Function to setup a system of bodies for the patched conics trajectory. The system of bodies contains the central body, the transfer bodies and the body to be propagated. Default ephemeris is used for the central body but the ephemerides of the transfer bodies need to be provided as inputs.
nameCentralBody
Name of the central body.
nameBodyToPropagate
Name of the body to be propagated.
nameTransferBodies
Vector containing the names of the transfer bodies.
ephemerisVectorTransferBodies
Vector containing the ephemeris pointers of the different transfer bodies.
gravitationalParametersTransferBodies
Vector containing the gravitational parameters of the transfer bodies [m^3 s^-2].
Body map for the patched conics trajectory.
Function to setup a system of bodies corresponding to the assumptions of the patched conics trajectory, the ephemerides of the transfer bodies being provided as inputs.

briefdescription.para: Function to both calculate a patched conics leg including a DSM and propagate the corresponding full dynamics problem.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to both calculate a patched conics leg including a DSM and propagate the corresponding full dynamics problem. The patched conics leg with DSM is calculated using the velocity formulation.
bodies
Body map for the patched conics leg.
departureAndArrivalBodies
Vector containing the names of the departure and arrival bodies of the leg.
dsm
Name of the DSM.
centralBody
Name of the central body of the patched conics trajectory.
cartesianPositionAtDeparture
Cartesian position of the body to be propagated at the leg departure [m].
cartesianPositionDSM
Cartesian position of the body to be propagated at the DSM location [m].
cartesianPositionAtArrival
Cartesian position of the body to be propagated at the leg arrival [m].
initialTime
Time at departure [s].
timeDsm
Time at which the DSM is to be performed [s].
timeArrival
Time at arrival [s].
legType
Type of the leg.
trajectoryVariableVector
Trajectory variable vector characterising the leg.
semiMajorAxis
Semi-major axis at trajectory departure (only used for a departure leg and not a swing-by one) [m].
eccentricity
Eccentricity at trajectory departure (only used for a departure leg and not a swing-by one).
velocityAfterDeparture
Velocity coordinates of the body to be propagated just after the swing-by it has performed about the departure body of the leg [m/s].
velocityBeforeArrival
Velocity coordinates of the body to be propagated just before it reaches the arrival body of the leg [m/s].
propagatorSettingsBeforeDsm
Propagator settings for the full problem propagation from the departure body to the DSM location.
propagatorSettingsAfterDsm
propagators settings for the full problem propagation from the DSM location to the arrival body.
integratorSettings
Integrator settings for the propagation of the full dynamics problem.
patchedConicsResultFromDepartureToDsm
Patched conics solution for the first part of the leg (from departure body to DSM).
fullProblemResultFromDepartureToDsm
propagation results of the full dynamics problem for the first part of the leg (from departure body to DSM).
patchedConicsResultFromDsmToArrival
Patched conics solution for the second part of the leg (from DSM to arrival body).
fullProblemResultFromDsmToArrival
propagation results of the full dynamics problem for the second part of the leg (from DSM to arrival body).

memberdef.argsstring: (simulation_setup::SystemOfBodies &bodies, const std::vector< std::string > departureAndArrivalBodies, const std::string &dsm, const std::string &centralBody, const Eigen::Vector3d cartesianPositionAtDeparture, const Eigen::Vector3d cartesianPositionDSM, const Eigen::Vector3d cartesianPositionAtArrival, const double initialTime, const double timeDsm, const double timeArrival, const transfer_trajectories::TransferLegType &legType, const std::vector< double > &trajectoryVariableVector, const double minimumPericenterRadius, const double semiMajorAxis, const double eccentricity, Eigen::Vector3d &velocityAfterDeparture, Eigen::Vector3d &velocityBeforeArrival, const std::pair< std::shared_ptr< propagators::TranslationalStatePropagatorSettings< double > >, std::shared_ptr< propagators::TranslationalStatePropagatorSettings< double > > > propagatorSettingsBeforeDsm, const std::pair< std::shared_ptr< propagators::TranslationalStatePropagatorSettings< double > >, std::shared_ptr< propagators::TranslationalStatePropagatorSettings< double > > > propagatorSettingsAfterDsm, const std::shared_ptr< numerical_integrators::IntegratorSettings< double > > &integratorSettings, std::map< double, Eigen::Vector6d > &patchedConicsResultFromDepartureToDsm, std::map< double, Eigen::Vector6d > &fullProblemResultFromDepartureToDsm, std::map< double, Eigen::VectorXd > &dependentVariablesFromDepartureToDsm, std::map< double, Eigen::Vector6d > &patchedConicsResultFromDsmToArrival, std::map< double, Eigen::Vector6d > &fullProblemResultFromDsmToArrival, std::map< double, Eigen::VectorXd > &dependentVariablesFromDsmToArrival)
memberdef.name: propagateMga1DsmPositionAndFullProblem

Time at departure [s].

timeArrival
Time at arrival [s].
legType
Type of the leg.

Trajectory variable vector characterising the leg.
minimumPericenterRadius
Minimum pericenter radius (only used for a swing-by leg and not a trajectory departure one).
semiMajorAxis
Semi-major axis at trajectory departure (only used for a departure leg and not a swing-by one) [m].
eccentricity
Eccentricity at trajectory departure (only used for a departure leg and not a swing-by one).
velocityAfterDeparture
Velocity coordinates of the body to be propagated just after the swing-by it has performed about the departure body of the leg [m/s].
velocityBeforeArrival
Velocity coordinates of the body to be propagated just before it reaches the arrival body of the leg [m/s].

patchedConicsResultFromDsmToArrival

fullProblemResultFromDsmToArrival

param.type: const std::pair< std::shared_ptr< propagators::TranslationalStatePropagatorSettings< double > >, std::shared_ptr< propagators::TranslationalStatePropagatorSettings< double > > >

briefdescription.para: Function to propagate the motion of a body over a trajectory leg, both along a keplerian orbit and in a full dynamics problem.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to propagate the motion of a body over a trajectory leg, both along a keplerian orbit and in a full dynamics problem.
timeOfFlight
Time of flight during which the body has to be propagated [s]
initialTime
Initial time [s].
bodies
Body map defining the problem.
centralBody
Name of the central body of the keplerian trajectory.
departureAndArrivalBodies
Name of the departure and arrival bodies of the leg.
velocityAfterDeparture
Velocity coordinates of the body to be propagated just after the swing-by it has performed about the departure body of the leg [m/s].
propagatorSettings
Propagator settings for the propagation of the full dynamics problem.
integratorSettings
Integrator settings for the propagation of the full dynamics problem.
keplerianOrbitResult
Keplerian orbit solution.
fullProblemResult
propagation results of the full problem.
centralBodyGravitationalParameter
Gravitational parameter of the central body [m^3 s^-2]. If not provided as input, it is retrieved from the system of bodies.
cartesianPositionAtDeparture
Cartesian position of the body to the propagated at the leg departure [m]. If not provided as input, it is retrieved from the ephemerides.

memberdef.argsstring: (simulation_setup::SystemOfBodies &bodies, const std::vector< std::string > &transferBodyOrder, const std::string &patchedConicCentralBody, const std::vector< transfer_trajectories::TransferLegType > &legTypeVector, const std::vector< double > &trajectoryVariableVector, const std::vector< double > &minimumPericenterRadiiVector, const std::vector< double > &semiMajorAxesVector, const std::vector< double > &eccentricitiesVector, const std::vector< std::pair< std::shared_ptr< propagators::TranslationalStatePropagatorSettings< double > >, std::shared_ptr< propagators::TranslationalStatePropagatorSettings< double > > > > propagatorSettings, const std::shared_ptr< numerical_integrators::IntegratorSettings< double > > &integratorSettings, std::map< int, std::map< double, Eigen::Vector6d > > &patchedConicsResultForEachLeg, std::map< int, std::map< double, Eigen::Vector6d > > &fullProblemResultForEachLeg, std::map< int, std::map< double, Eigen::VectorXd > > &dependentVariableResultForEachLeg)
memberdef.name: fullPropagationPatchedConicsTrajectory

param.type: const std::vector< std::pair< std::shared_ptr< propagators::TranslationalStatePropagatorSettings< double > >, std::shared_ptr< propagators::TranslationalStatePropagatorSettings< double > > > >

briefdescription.para: Function to calculate the patched conics trajectory and to propagate the corresponding full problem.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to calculate the patched conics trajectory and to propagate the corresponding full problem. The propagator settings to be used for the propagation of the full dynamics problem are directly provided as inputs.
bodies
Body map for the patched conics trajectory.
transferBodyOrder
Vector containing the names of the transfer bodies involved in the trajectory.
patchedConicCentralBody
Name of the central body of the patched conics trajectory.
legTypeVector
Vector containing the leg types.
trajectoryVariableVector
Vector containing all the defining variables for the whole trajectory.
minimumPericenterRadiiVector
Vector containing the minimum distance between the spacecraft and the body.
semiMajorAxesVector
Vector containing the semi-major axes of the departure and arrival legs.
eccentricitiesVector
Vector containing the eccentricities of the departure and arrival legs.
propagatorSettings
Vector containing a pair of propagator settings for each leg (one for the backward and the other for the forward propagation)
integratorSettings
Integrator settings for the propagation of the full problem.
patchedConicsResultForEachLeg
Patched conics solution along each leg.
fullProblemResultForEachLeg
Full problem propagation results along each leg.

memberdef.argsstring: (simulation_setup::SystemOfBodies &bodies, const std::vector< basic_astrodynamics::AccelerationMap > &accelerationMap, const std::vector< std::string > &transferBodyOrder, const std::string &centralBody, const std::string &bodyToPropagate, const std::vector< transfer_trajectories::TransferLegType > &legTypeVector, const std::vector< double > &trajectoryVariableVector, const std::vector< double > &minimumPericenterRadiiVector, const std::vector< double > &semiMajorAxesVector, const std::vector< double > &eccentricitiesVector, const std::shared_ptr< numerical_integrators::IntegratorSettings< double > > &integratorSettings, std::map< int, std::map< double, Eigen::Vector6d > > &patchedConicsResultForEachLeg, std::map< int, std::map< double, Eigen::Vector6d > > &fullProblemResultForEachLeg, std::map< int, std::map< double, Eigen::VectorXd > > &dependentVariableResultForEachLeg, const bool terminationSphereOfInfluence=false, const std::vector< std::shared_ptr< DependentVariableSaveSettings > > dependentVariablesToSave=std::vector< std::shared_ptr< DependentVariableSaveSettings > >(), const TranslationalPropagatorType propagator=cowell)
memberdef.name: fullPropagationPatchedConicsTrajectory

briefdescription.para: Function to calculate the patched conics trajectory and to propagate the corresponding full problem.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to calculate the patched conics trajectory and to propagate the corresponding full problem. The propagator settings for the full problem propagation are defined inside the function from the propagator type and dependent variables to save which are provided as inputs.
bodies
Body map for the patched conics trajectory.
accelerationMap
Vector of acceleration maps for each leg to propagate the full problem.
transferBodyOrder
Vector containing the names of the transfer bodies involved in the trajectory.
centralBody
Name of the central body of the patched conics trajectory.
bodyToPropagate
Name of the body to be propagated.
legTypeVector
Vector containing the leg types.
trajectoryVariableVector
Vector containing all the defining variables for the whole trajectory.
minimumPericenterRadiiVector
Vector containing the minimum distance between the spacecraft and the body.
semiMajorAxesVector
Vector containing the semi-major axes of the departure and arrival legs.
eccentricitiesVector
Vector containing the eccentricities of the departure and arrival legs.
integratorSettings
Integrator settings for the propagation of the full problem.
patchedConicsResultForEachLeg
Patched conics solution along each leg.
fullProblemResultForEachLeg
Full problem propagation results along each leg.
terminationSphereOfInfluence
Boolean denoting whether the propagation stops at the exact position (false) or at the sphere of influence (true) of the departure and arrival body of each leg of the trajectory. The default value is false.
dependentVariablesToSave
Vector containing the dependent variables to be saved during the full problem propagation for each leg.
propagator
Type of propagator to be used for the full problem propagation.

Function to calculate the patched conics trajectory and to propagate the corresponding full problem with the same acceleration map for every leg. The propagator settings for the full problem propagation are defined inside the function from the propagator type and dependent variables to save provided as inputs.
bodies

accelerationMap
Acceleration map (to be used for every leg) to propagate the full problem.
transferBodyOrder
Vector containing the names of the transfer bodies involved in the trajectory.
centralBody
Name of the central body of the patched conics trajectory.
bodyToPropagate
Name of the body to be propagated.
legTypeVector
Vector containing the leg types.
trajectoryVariableVector
Vector containing all the defining variables for the whole trajectory.
minimumPericenterRadiiVector
Vector containing the minimum distance between the spacecraft and the body.
semiMajorAxesVector
Vector containing the semi-major axes of the departure and arrival legs.
eccentricitiesVector
Vector containing the eccentricities of the departure and arrival legs.
integratorSettings
Integrator settings for the propagation of the full problem.
patchedConicsResultForEachLeg
Patched conics solution along each leg.
fullProblemResultForEachLeg
Full problem propagation results along each leg.
terminationSphereOfInfluence
Boolean denoting whether the propagation stops at the exact position (false) or at the sphere of influence (true) of the departure and arrival body of each leg of the trajectory. The default value is false.
dependentVariablesToSave
Vector containing the dependent variables to be saved during the full problem propagation for each leg.
propagator
Type of propagator to be used for the full problem propagation.
Function to calculate the patched conics trajectory and to propagate the corresponding full problem with the same acceleration map for every leg.

detaileddescription.para: Function to compute the difference in cartesian state between patched conics trajectory and full dynamics problem, at both departure and arrival positions for each leg.

Function to compute the difference in cartesian state between patched conics trajectory and full dynamics problem, at both departure and arrival positions for each leg. The propagator settings to be used for the propagation of the full dynamics problem are directly provided as inputs.
bodies
Body map for the patched conics trajectory.
transferBodyOrder
Vector containing the names of the transfer bodies involved in the trajectory.
centralBody
Name of the central body of the patched conics trajectory.
legTypeVector
Vector containing the leg types.
trajectoryVariableVector
Vector containing all the defining variables for the whole trajectory.
minimumPericenterRadiiVector
Vector containing the minimum distance between the spacecraft and the body.
semiMajorAxesVector
Vector containing the semi-major axes of the departure and arrival legs.
eccentricitiesVector
Vector containing the eccentricities of the departure and arrival legs.
propagatorSettings
Vector containing a pair of propagator settings for each leg (one for the backward and the other for the forward propagation)
integratorSettings
Integrator settings for the propagation of the full problem.
Map of vector pairs. Each vector pair contains the difference in cartesian state between patched conics trajectory and full problem for a given leg, at departure and arrival respectively.
Function to compute the difference in cartesian state between patched conics trajectory and full dynamics problem, at both departure and arrival positions for each leg.

The propagator settings for the full problem propagation are defined inside the function from the propagator type and dependent variables to save provided as inputs.
bodies
Body map for the patched conics trajectory.
accelerationMap

transferBodyOrder
Vector containing the names of the transfer bodies involved in the trajectory.
centralBody
Name of the central body of the patched conics trajectory.

Name of the body to be propagated.
legTypeVector
Vector containing the leg types.
trajectoryVariableVector
Vector containing all the defining variables for the whole trajectory.

Vector containing the minimum distance between the spacecraft and the body.

Vector containing the semi-major axes of the departure and arrival legs.
eccentricitiesVector
Vector containing the eccentricities of the departure and arrival legs.
integratorSettings
Integrator settings for the propagation of the full problem.
terminationSphereOfInfluence
Boolean denoting whether the propagation stops at the exact position (false) or at the sphere of influence (true) of the departure and arrival body of each leg of the trajectory. The default value is false.
dependentVariablesToSave
Vector containing the dependent variables to be saved during the full problem propagation for each leg.
propagator
Type of propagator to be used for the full problem propagation.
Map of vector pairs. Each vector pair contains the difference in cartesian state between patched conics trajectory and full problem for a given leg, at departure and arrival respectively.

legTypeVector

trajectoryVariableVector
Vector containing all the defining variables for the whole trajectory.
minimumPericenterRadiiVector
Vector containing the minimum distance between the spacecraft and the body.
semiMajorAxesVector
Vector containing the semi-major axes of the departure and arrival legs.
eccentricitiesVector
Vector containing the eccentricities of the departure and arrival legs.
integratorSettings
Integrator settings for the propagation of the full problem.
terminationSphereOfInfluence
Boolean denoting whether the propagation stops at the exact position (false) or at the sphere of influence (true) of the departure and arrival body of each leg of the trajectory. The default value is false.
dependentVariablesToSave
Vector containing the dependent variables to be saved during the full problem propagation for each leg.
propagator
Type of propagator to be used for the full problem propagation.
Map of vector pairs. Each vector pair contains the difference in cartesian state between patched conics trajectory and full problem for a given leg, at departure and arrival respectively.

briefdescription.para: Function to create multi-arc propagator settings by merging an existing multi-arc with single-arc settings.

detaileddescription.para:

The single-arc settings are converted to multi-arc, and the single-arc propagated bodies are appended at the beginning of the vector of propagated bodies. Currently, only translational dynamics is supported.

Single-arc settings that are to be added (to the head of the list of propagated bodies) of the input multi-arc settings.

numberofArcs
Number of arcs in which the single-arc dynamics is to be split
Multi-arc propagator settings by merging an existing multi-arc with single-arc settings

briefdescription.para: Function to convert output of translational motion to input for the ephemeris.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to convert output of translational motion from the numerical integrator to the required input for the ephemeris. It extracts the state history of a single body from the full list of integrated states Additionally, it changes the origin of the reference frame in which the states are given, by using the integrationToEphemerisFrameFunction input variable.
bodyIndex
Index of integrated body for which the state is to be retrieved
startIndex
Index in entries of equationsOfMotionNumericalSolution where the translational states start.
equationsOfMotionNumericalSolution
Full numerical solution of numerical integrator, already converted to Cartesian states (w.r.t. the integration origin of the body of bodyIndex)
ephemerisTable
State history of body bodyIndex w.r.t. the origin with which its ephemeris is defined (returned by reference).
integrationToEphemerisFrameFunction
Function to provide the state of the ephemeris origin of the current body w.r.t. its integration origin.
